title: A quick list of updates
body:
1. I quit my telemarketing job last night. I guess I don't have the same tolerance for telemarketing as I did when I was a senior in high school. Imagine that.

2. There's a new phlog.

3. See that cheesy looking graphic over in the sidebar? That's your portal to the twisty turvy world of the Moxie budget. Marvel at how quickly $65,000 can vanish into thin air! Will we have enough to pull through? Stay tuned to find out!

4. I'm in the very, very, very early stages of negotiating our first vendor-sponsored advertising trade-off. If it works out, it could end up saving us a couple grand. That's all I can say right now, lest I put my foot in my mouth and ruin everything.

5. My back's feeling better, and snot is issuing forth from my head like nobody's business.

6. Enjoy!
author: Dan

comments.author: Oz
comments.body: I'm first!  Not surprised you couldn't stand the telemarketing thing.  We're willing to deal with a lot more when we're in high school than as adults.  Ah, I remember the good ole days of working the drive-thru at McDonald's....

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Damn telemarketing and McDonald's... damn them to hell!

comments.author: James
comments.body: So, you're getting a Simplex, eh?  Never worked with one myself, but I've heard good things about it.

comments.author: einahpets
comments.body:
Hi Dan.

Darn it. No more waiting by the phone to hear your voice trying to sell me a vacation.

comments.author: Beavis
comments.body: That's good, sit home in the recliner eating salami all day.  Not a bad way to live.

comments.author: whitty
comments.body:
I cut through the Moxie parking lot on the way to the bank, I hope that is okay.

Dang, one-way Campbell St.

comments.author: matt
comments.body: hey dan, have you thought about taking a page out of the non-profit world's book and offering sponsorships of some of those items on your 'equipment we cannot do without' list?  it's a silly concept in general, but for smaller stuff, hell, i'd pay $180 just for the humor value of a little brass plate commemorating the "Zeroplate Hand Sink".  just a thought.

comments.author: Aaron
comments.body:
Can't Matthew Lesko get you guys a bunch of cash from the guvment or something?

I'd be willing to donate some cash for a case or two of Fitz's, so long as you let me drink about half of it. Deal?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
James: Indeed, Simplexes are built like tanks... with 50mm guns and everything.

Eina: Hi Stephy. Sorry I can't sell you a vacation.

Beavis: Dude, pick a new meat... salami's SO nineties!

Whitty: That's not okay. If you do it again, I'll chase you away with a broom!

Matt: That's an idea. Are you saying you want to donate the money for a hand sink?

Aaron: Deal.

comments.author: Chuck
comments.body: Don't feel bad, Dan. I quit working at Disneyland before I even got into the park - and that's the happiest place on Earth.

comments.author: J.R.
comments.body: We're all for the poorhouse now...
